intro: Hiraea strigulosa, commonly known as the rough hiraea, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
